alert.note: Alert for Piscataquis (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 13 at 6:09PM EDT until August 13 at 6:45PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of East Central and North Central Maine, including the following counties, in East Central Maine, Penobscot. In North Central Maine, Piscataquis. * WHEN...Until 815 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Water over roadways. Some low-lying water crossings will be impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 607 PM EDT, emergency management reported heavy rain with flooded roads and localized washouts in Levant, Cornith, and Charleston due to thunderstorms. This is causing urban and small stream flooding. Up to 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Levant, Cornith, and Charleston is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Old Town, Newport, Hermon, Corinth, Kenduskeag, East Corinth, Orneville, Indian Island, Glenburn, Milford, Levant, Corinna, Hudson, Bradley, Greenbush and Charleston. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
